alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Basin and Range (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 30 at 1:50PM MDT until May 31 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND THE WEST CENTRAL BASIN AND RANGE DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY VALUES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .South to southwest winds will strengthen on Wednesday in advance of an approaching upper level storm system. Meanwhile, drier air will advance into western and central New Mexico. During the peak heating hours, expect 20-foot wind gusts between 30-35 mph with minimum relative humidities dipping into the single digits. With high Haines values, expect areas of critical fire weather across the middle Rio Grande Valley and parts of the west central basin and range. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...This includes the Middle Rio Grande Valley (Zone 106) and the West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109). * 20 FOOT WINDS...South to southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values between 8 and 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Basin and Range
